website_summaries.verdict: The Origin EON15-X is a high-end gaming laptop that delivers strong processing power and serious gaming performance.
pros: Solid gaming performance, thanks to an Nvidia GeForce GTX 980M graphics card
Lots of storage space with a speedy PCIe-connected solid-state drive
cons: No touch screen or optical drive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic laptop. Runs GTA V at 1080p with almost max settings at 60fps. Very impressed! Heat vents work brilliantly too and keep heat away from the areas of the machine you touch (underneath and keyboard). Highly recommended gaming laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bevan

customer_reviews.title: It's a gentle brute...
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a month. Runs BF4, WarFrame and Stranded Deep on ultra and high settings, no sweat. My only gripe is, it has a cluster of 4 or 5 dead pixels. But this is not a big deal because I plan to use another monitor as my main viewing screen. Is it worth the money? Time will tell. I'm optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for photo/video editing
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Very powerful, fast, crisp screen, nice keyboard. I use it for video editing, and it does it very well. I would strongly recommend it if you edit video and photo.It's very easy to upgrade. Now I have two SSDs and one big HDD, and 16GB of RAM. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey Larchenko

customer_reviews.title: A1 You must get !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: TOP TOP Laptop. you got to get one of these, the speed is just great !!
customer_reviews.author: FW

customer_reviews.title: Really Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This Laptop is great. No Noise even when Elite Dangerous is on high settings. Pictures do not do it justice, in real its really nice to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda

customer_reviews.title: Good so far. Will submit a more thorough review later
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Build quality good. Replaced the 1TB HDD with an SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money laptop
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing and giving detailed consideration I decided on the Asus G750 JS, with 6GB DDR5 video ram. Great value for money, picture quality is excellent overall a very fast machine.
customer_reviews.author: PAULD

customer_reviews.title: Good gameing laptop
customer_reviews.text: Good laptop it can run most games but it stutters even on medium don't know why but it is very good preformance for the money
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: ASUS G750 series - dead in less than 4 years ...
customer_reviews.text: My Asus G750JS died after 3 years 10 months - extremely disappointed given the almost £1200 price tag. I notice that this model has since been replaced by the G750JZ (same configuration as the JS), but I don't advise buying it, or any of the Asus gaming laptops. In conclusion, you're better off buying a PC gaming tower - gaming laptops suffer the potential fate of the motherboard burning out due to overheating - air cooling is very much better in a tower (there are more fans), thereby reducing this risk. Also you get more for your money with a PC tower: it's half-the-price and all parts are upgradable ...
customer_reviews.author: Azure777

customer_reviews.title: This is great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the money, beats most other laptops simply because of the fan system being so good. Great tec support I have had some software problems where the track-pad stopped working two weeks after buying the laptop but the tec support has offered me a free fix. Speaker are so amazing for a laptop, screen is perfect the laptop looks so much nicer than the pictures make it out. Keyboard is awesome. All in all well built, nice finishes and does everything you would need it to, it's a safe choice and a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bouchier

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop. sturdy and well worth the money. boots to desktop from off in less than 7 seconds, it's sturdy, literally the only downside so far is the weight. Windows 8 is bearable
customer_reviews.author: Deneo

customer_reviews.title: Good gaming laptop
customer_reviews.text: Very happy so far with this laptop, fast as you like and does everything I want it to.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Amis

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased. Can't fault it so far
customer_reviews.text: Really solid laptop. Well made. Big screen. Full HD. Fast graphics. Plays most FPS games on very high settings at max resolution. I have no problems with Dishonoured from Steam, for example. On some very demanding games (like a Flight Sim with 100 mile draw distance) this laptop will lag...but then what do you expect, this is essentially a desktop replacement laptop with a decent nVidia graphics card for around £1000, and not a £3000 gaming rig with the top-spec of everything! You get what you pay for. I am very pleased. Can't fault it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nearly as quick as my Overclocked Desktop PC. Using it for 3D Cad & and rendering. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Good luck.
customer_reviews.text: Just writing to let the hardcore know I had no problem replacing the wireless card and the second hard disk in this. You don't need to take the whole thing apart to upgrade either the RAM, second hard disk or wireless. Its all accessible just by taking off 2 screws and the panel at the front bottom. The primary hard disk will need work to replace though. I put in an intel 7260 and 850 Evo. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: A user

customer_reviews.title: The best laptop I've ever had! Does everything and more!
customer_reviews.text: Had this laptop for a couple of weeks now and have to say it is brilliant. Great for anything, great display, really silent. Perfect all round laptop for the price Diablo 3 - 60FPS GTA V (Medium/High) - 55-60FPS Perfect for Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects etc. Great for multitasking and is not very heavy. Best laptop I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Ronan Frew

customer_reviews.title: +++ Good performance on any game you throw at it... +++
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this Asus is a superb gaming laptop. With the Blu-ray drive, it betters the Alienware (its top competitor), but both seem expensive compared to other options on the market. If you can afford it, this is a superb buy. Pros: + Good performance + Dedicated graphics + 1TB of storage + Blu-ray drive + Good connectivity Cons: - Heavy - No touchscreen for Windows 8 - Battery life not great A top gaming laptop, but due to price its worth comparing with this version by MSI to get a better overall idea of specs and differences the two items might have, found here:
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Delivering awesome gaming power in a sleek design
customer_reviews.text: The Asus G750JZ makes the most of Nvidia's new GeForce GTX 880M graphics, delivering awesome gaming power in a sleek design. Pros: + Top-end gaming performance + Runs quiet and cool + Attractive design + Very good battery life Cons: - Expensive - Keyboard not customizable A top notch gaming laptop, but worth comparing with this version by Asus on price and performance:
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: will not do 3D gaming screen only 60hrz
customer_reviews.text: This is not a 3d laptop the hrz on the screen is only 60hrz not 120hrz In the description is says it supports Nvidia 3d vision so you can use the Nvidia 3d glasses This is not the case. So if you are going to buy this laptop for the 3d support don't as I will not Support 3d and also its a 128GB ssd not a 256GB SSD bench test score from 3d mark ice storm 104431 sky diver 14917 alienware alpha .......... ice storm 102121 not bad for a £700 mini pc compered to a £1.100 laptop
customer_reviews.author: surfbum2009

product_meta.title: ASUS G551JW 15.6-Inch Notebook (Intel Core i7-4720HQ 2.6 Ghz, 12 GB RAM, 1TB HDD, Webcam, Windows 8.1) with Free Windows 10 Upgrade
product_meta.description:
The ASUS Republic of Gamers (ROG) G series delivers powerful performance, thanks to Intel Core i processors and gaming-grade Nvidia GTX series graphics. Be immersed in gaming worlds through its Full HD IPS panel with 178 viewing angles, complemented by ASUS SonicMaster and ROG AudioWizard enhanced audio. Its efficient thermal management system works silently in the background to give you uninterrupted, comfortable marathon gaming sessions.

Note:Always connect you laptop charger while doing Graphic Intensive functions. Power Adapter Output is 19 Voltage Direct Current, 6.3 Ampere, 120 Wattage (Quad Core).

BOX CONTAINS
ASUS notebook
AC Adapter
User Documentation
feature_bullets: High-performance gaming laptop with enthusiast-grade graphics and silent cooling system

A Full HD display with wide viewing angles gives you clear, crisp gaming visuals. If that isn't enough, Trinity Display technology lets you hook up the G series to three other monitors for additional multitasking capabilities
Bold, modern lines with a stealthy matte-black brushed aluminum finish. An illuminated ROG logo proudly reflects its gaming heritage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars31 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
